name: Accordion
description: The Accordion component is a combination of an accessible button (header area) and a content container.

props.name: id
props.doc: A unique `id` that will be used on the button element. If you use `remember_state`, an id is required.

props.name: title
props.doc: A title as a string or React element. It will be used as the button text.

props.name: expanded
props.doc: If set to `true` the accordion will be expanded as its initial state.

props.name: expanded_ssr
props.doc: If set to `true` the accordion will be expanded during SSR. Can be potentially useful for SEO, although it will disturb client hydration, where React expects the same state. But that's mainly a technical aspect to consider.

props.name: remember_state
props.doc: If set to `true`, it will remember a changed state initiated by the user. It requires a unique `id`. It will store the state in the local storage.

props.name: flush_remembered_state
props.doc: If set to `true`, the saved (remembered) state will be removed and the initial component state will be used and set.

props.name: no_animation
props.doc: If set to `true`, the open and close animation will be omitted.

props.name: variant
props.doc: Defines the used styling. `Outlined`, `filled`, or `plain` (no styling). Defaults to `outlined`.

props.name: icon
props.doc: Will replace the `chevron` icon. The icon will still rotate (by CSS). You can use an object to use two different icons, one for the closed state and one for the expanded state `{ closed, expanded }`.

props.name: icon_position
props.doc: Will set the placement of the icon. Defaults to `left`.

props.name: icon_size
props.doc: Define a different icon size. Defaults to `medium` (1.5rem).

props.name: left_component
props.doc: Will add a React element on the left side of the `title`, inside `AccordionHeaderContainer`.

props.name: prerender
props.doc: If set to `true` the content will be present, even the accordion is not expanded. Can be useful for assistive technology or SEO.

props.name: prevent_rerender
props.doc: If set to `true` the accordion component will not re-render its content – can be useful for components you don't have control of storing the temporary state during an interaction.

props.name: prevent_rerender_conditional
props.doc: Use this prop together with `prevent_rerender` – and if it is set to `true`, the accordion component will re-render if the children are a new React element and do not match the previous one anymore.

props.name: single_container
props.doc: If set to `true`, a group of accordions will be wrapped to a sidebar looking menu for medium and larger screens.

props.name: element
props.doc: Gives you the option to replace the used `button` element. Provide a React element, including a string (HTML element). Defaults to a `div` with all the needed accessibility features included.

props.name: heading
props.doc: If set to `true`, level 2 (h2) will be used. You can provide your own HTML heading (`h3`), or provide a `heading_level` property.

props.name: heading_level
props.doc: If `heading` is set to `true`, you can provide a numeric value to define a different heading level. Defaults to `2`.

props.name: disabled
props.doc: If set to `true`, the accordion button will be disabled (dimmed).

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: contentRef
props.doc: Send along a custom React Ref for `.dnb-accordion__content`.

props.name: collapseAllHandleRef
props.doc: Ref handle to collapse all expanded accordions. Send in a ref and use `.current()` to collapse all accordions. Default: `undefined`.

props.name: space
props.doc: Spacing properties like `top` or `bottom` are supported.

props.name: group
props.doc: Define a unique id, it will be used to 'group' several accordions into one.

props.name: allow_close_all
props.doc: If set to `true`, the group of accordions will allow all to close.

props.name: expandBehaviour
props.doc: Use `expandBehavior` instead.

props.name: expandBehavior
props.doc: Determines how many accordions can be expanded at once. Defaults to `single`.

props.name: expanded_id
props.doc: Define an `id` of a nested accordion that will get expanded.

events.name: on_change
events.doc: Will be called by user click interaction. Returns an object with a boolean state `expanded` inside `{ expanded, id, event, ...event }`.
